jobs.title: Monitoring, Evaluation, Research & Learning (MERL) Coordinator
jobs.reporting_to: Chief Operations Officer, with dotted line to Chief Mentor

overview.about_sph: Swahilipot Hub Foundation is a non-profit organization founded in 2016 by Mahmoud Noor, nurturing youth talents in technology and creatives/arts through youth-led programs and community spaces for co-working, meeting, networking, and learning.
overview.position_summary: The MERL Coordinator oversees the implementation of Monitoring, Evaluation, Research, and Learning activities for SPH’s Kenya programme, covering pathways like Case Management, Creative, Data Science, Health, Manufacturing, Entrepreneurship, Hospitality & Tourism, and Youth Hub Network.

jobs.scope: Design, implement, and improve M&E systems to track progress, outputs, and outcomes, ensuring alignment with SPH MERL standards.
responsibilities: Develop and implement M&E frameworks for qualitative and quantitative data tracking.
Facilitate use of M&E findings for strategic reviews and adaptive programme design.
Ensure accountability and transparency in reporting.
Collaborate with programme managers and partners for data collection and analysis.
Provide technical leadership in MERL capacity-building.
Support documentation and dissemination of lessons learned and best practices.
key_areas: Coordinate MERL agenda for SPH programme portfolio.
Develop M&E frameworks, indicators, protocols, and tools.
Produce high-quality M&E reports for donors and management.
Conduct programme quality assessments and field monitoring.
Co-lead reviews and reflections with project leads and COO.
Manage performance of Data Administrators, interns, and volunteers.
qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in international development, economics, statistics, or social sciences.
Minimum 3 years in M&E of development programmes, with 2 years in management.
Knowledge of Results-Based Management, logic models, and SMART indicators.
Experience in survey design and qualitative studies.
Proficiency in SPSS or STATA; knowledge of Ms Access or CSPro desirable.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills.

application.submission: Cover letter, CV, and three professional referees
application.note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

jobs.title: Data Administrator

overview.about_sph: Swahilipot Hub Foundation is a non-profit organization founded in 2016 by Mahmoud Noor, nurturing youth talents in technology and creatives/arts through youth-led programs and community spaces for co-working, meeting, networking, and learning.
overview.position_summary: The Data Administrator supports the MERL team by ensuring accurate data collection, management, analysis, and reporting for SPH’s programmes.

jobs.scope: Manage day-to-day data systems and processes within the MERL framework, supporting programmes like Case Management, Data Science, Health, Manufacturing, Entrepreneurship, Hospitality & Tourism, and Youth Hub Network.
responsibilities: Develop and implement data management systems for accuracy and consistency.
Support data analysis for programme performance reviews.
Ensure data integrity through audits and validation checks.
Assist in capacity building for staff, interns, and volunteers in data management.
Collaborate with programme teams to align data with objectives.
Document data management processes and lessons learned.
Manage relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server).
Understand data governance, privacy, and security frameworks.
key_areas: Develop and implement data management systems.
Support data analysis for programme performance.
Ensure data integrity through audits and validation.
Assist in capacity building for data management.
Collaborate with programme teams on data alignment.
Document data processes and lessons learned.
Understand data governance and privacy frameworks.
qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Information Management, or related field.
At least 2 years of experience in data management, preferably in NGO/development sector.
Strong knowledge of data collection, quality assurance, and reporting.
Proficiency in Excel, SPSS, or STATA.

application.submission: Cover letter, CV, and three professional referees
application.note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
